intro: Argostemma gesnerella, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. Argostemma gesnerella is often found in wetlands and along stream banks, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments.
